text.headline: Growth of ion acoustic waves
text.text:
Growth of isolated ion acoustic modes in the shearing box

unfinished semester project with M. Kunz

In 3D hybrid-PIC MRI simulations it is observed that certain ion acoustic oscillations were being Landau-damped while others were picked up and amplified by mirror instability. Presumably this is due to the fact that shearing is amplifying the pressure anisotropy for some modes, and the mirror threshold is being reached before the wave are damped. Our goal was to study this effect in a localized 2D shearing simulation with an isolated ion acoustic mode and compare the results with analytic predictions.

skills: hybrid-PIC simulations, plasma theory

text.headline: Two-photon pair production in reconnection
text.text:
Two-photon pair production in pulsar magnetospheres

project with A. Philippov and A. Spitkovsky

Magnetic reconnection is thought to power the pulsed high-energy emission from pulsars. Photons produced via the synchrotron radiation of the accelerated plasma particles, can interact with each other to produce fresh pair-plasma. This process self-balances towards an equilibrium which depends weakly on specific reconnection pulsar conditions. We developed the first-of-its-kind pair-production algorithm for PIC codes coupled to the synchrotron radiation of charged particles to demonstrate this self-balancing phenomenon in localized reconnection simulations.

arXiv:1809.10772

skills: PIC simulations, PIC code dev

text.headline: Relativistic MHD turbulence
text.text:
Current sheets in relativistic MHD turbulence

unfinished semester project with J. Stone

The role of magnetic reconnection in the relativistic turbulent plasma is uncertain. Our goal was to study the formation and disruption of current sheets in the driven relativistic MHD turbulence. This would allow to understand how quickly the current sheets are formed in tubulent media and how long do they survive.

skills: MHD simulations, MHD code dev

text.headline: Secondary energization in reconnection
text.text:
Plasmoid compression in magnetic reconnection

project with M. Petropoulou, A. Spitkovsky and L. Sironi

We find that particles accelerated in the process of magnetic reconnection get trapped inside the plasmoids where their evolution continues. These particles get energized over time due to the compression of plasmoid interiors. As more plasma is being brought inside the plasmoid, an additional power-law tail emerges at energies exceeding those that can be provided by X-points.

arXiv:2006.12530

skills: PIC simulations, plasma theory

text.headline: Tristan-MP v2 development
text.text:
Tristan-MP v2 multi-species QED PIC code

with A. Spitkovsky, A. Philippov and D. Groselj

Tristan-MP v2 is the brand new version of the Tristan-MP particle-in-cell code, rewritten from scratch. It currently supports the following features:

  • multiple particle species
  • synchrotron and inverse-Compton radiation
  • two-photon pair production
  • Compton scattering
  • particle downsampling
  • guiding center (GCA) particle pusher

See details in the code wiki page.

skills: PIC algorithms, PIC code dev, HPC
